title: How to Make Buttery Mashed Potatoes

steps.headline: Put a pot of salt water on high heat.
steps.description: Allow it to start boiling as you work on peeling potatoes.

steps.headline: Cut the peeled potatoes into eighths.
Put the potatoes into the pot of water.
steps.description: Make sure you have enough water to submerge the potatoes by about 2 inches (5 cm).

steps.headline: Bring the water to a boil, then reduce to medium heat.
Allow the potatoes to cook over medium for about 20 minutes.

steps.headline: Drain the potatoes in a large colander.
steps.description: Allow them to rest and cool in the colander for 5 minutes.

steps.headline: Heat the broth and butter over medium heat.
steps.description: Use the same pot you used to cook the potatoes, and do this as the potatoes cool. When the butter has melted and mixed with the broth, remove from heat. Season with salt and pepper as desired.

steps.headline: Combine the potatoes and the broth.
steps.description:

Mash the potatoes by hand, and pour the broth into the mashed mixture. Use a fork to mix together roughly, being careful not to overwork the potatoes. Use a potato ricer to put the potatoes back into the pot with the broth. Fold together until the broth and potatoes are evenly combined.

text:
Put a pot of salt water on high heat. Allow it to start boiling as you work on peeling potatoes. Wash and peel the potatoes.  Cut the peeled potatoes into eighths.  Put the potatoes into the pot of water. Make sure you have enough water to submerge the potatoes by about 2 inches (5 cm). Bring the water to a boil, then reduce to medium heat.  Allow the potatoes to cook over medium for about 20 minutes. They should be tender and just about to fall apart when you stab them when a fork. Drain the potatoes in a large colander. Allow them to rest and cool in the colander for 5 minutes. Heat the broth and butter over medium heat. Use the same pot you used to cook the potatoes, and do this as the potatoes cool. When the butter has melted and mixed with the broth, remove from heat. Season with salt and pepper as desired. Combine the potatoes and the broth. Depending on the tools you have available, there's two options:
Mash the potatoes by hand, and pour the broth into the mashed mixture. Use a fork to mix together roughly, being careful not to overwork the potatoes. Use a potato ricer to put the potatoes back into the pot with the broth. Fold together until the broth and potatoes are evenly combined. Finished.
